betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You might have noticed that NEI shows recipes in machines with GU/t as power usage and total GU used for a recipe.
GregTech 6 has many different power types, which can be converted between each other (for example you can use EU (electrical units) to power a motor which will produce RU (rotational units).  Here is a list of all of the types of power that exist in GregT5ech 6:

GU - Generic Units (just used in NEI to show recipes, the machine itself will convert any other power types 1:1 into GU to produce the recipe)

EU - Electrical Units

RF - Redstone Flux

RU - Rotational Units (for everything that needs some spin)

KU - Kinetic Units

HU - Heat Units

LU - Laser Units (made by lasers to power welders etc)

QU - Quantum Units (used by high tech machines)

Converting between different energy types almost always have a loss (up to 50%), so try to use the appropiate enery type with as minimal conversions as possible. (always check the tooltips)
